benchmark_details.name: KatotohananQA
benchmark_details.overview: KatotohananQA is a Filipino adaptation of the TruthfulQA benchmark, aimed at evaluating an LLM’s truthfulness in Filipino, an under-resourced language, using a binary-choice format with 790 questions across 37 categories.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the truthfulness of Large Language Models when responding to questions in Filipino.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The limited breadth of dialects and languages, limited diversity of models evaluated, limitations imposed by a binary-choice setting, and lack of cultural diversity in the questions.

data.source: Translation from the original English TruthfulQA dataset through machine translation and manual verification.
data.annotation: Machine translated and verified by native Filipino speakers.

methodology.calculation: The accuracy is calculated by evaluating the model's response against the correct answer label.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better truthfulness in responses.
methodology.baseline_results: Average accuracy in English was 94.72% and in Filipino was 83.87%, with a mean difference of +10.85%.
methodology.validation: Statistical tests (McNemar’s test) were conducted to determine the significance of performance differences.
